intro: Thrixspermum cerinum, commonly known as the waxplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, wax-like coating on its leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance and helps reduce water loss. The plant produces small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in dry conditions. Thrixspermum cerinum is well adapted to arid environments and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
